name: The Quaddle Family Mysteries: Quaddle 3
overview: The third (and last) game in the The Quaddle Family Mysteries series of educational video games produced for the PlayStation by Lightspan. Your child is invited inside the fascinating Quaddle museum to help investigate the case of the missing scarab earring. Solving mathematical puzzles and problems in the museum's various rooms will provide clues to the earring's location. Features: - Find the area of a figure by covering it with nonstandard units of measure - Become familiar with units of time, lenght, area, capacity, temperature, and distance - Estimate time by using nonstandard units of measure - Explore nonstandard units of measure and relative measure - Determine and compare lenghts, perimeters, and areas of geometric shapes As with all Lightspan games, this title was not released to retail to the general public. Instead, it was only available to schools for educational purposes.
